rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all articles. Articles are the nonfictional prose forming an independent part of a publication.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Article

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: People who narrate audio books.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Audio Book Reader

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a narrator of audio books to a particular audio book to which the narrator provided the voice.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Audio Books Read

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The collection of audio editions of a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Audio Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links an audio edition of a written work to a person who reads (part of) the written work in the audio edition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Narrator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
An author is a creator of a written or published work. This type is used for an agent who has written prose (whether fiction, essay, journalism, or scholarship), poetry, drama, or written or edited a book of any sort. This therefore includes editors of anthologies, whether or not the editor has written any material included in the anthology. It also includes corporate authors, such as organizations, companies and government agencies, when a written work is credited to one, rather than to a person. It does not include scriptwriters for television and film (see the types mso:tv.writer and mso:film.writer for these).
Things that are authors:
## Poets (e.g. Sylvia Plath, Homer, T.S. Eliot).
## Novelists (e.g. J. K. Rowling, C.S. Lewis, Jane Austen).
## Playwrights (e.g. Arthur Laurents, Suzan-Lori Parks, Eve Ensler).
## Editors of anthologies (e.g. Dave Eggers, Joyce Carol Oates, Edward Gorman).
## Corporate authors, such as organizations, companies and government agencies (e.g. American Academy Of Pediatrics, Weight Watchers).
## Contributing authors: these are people who have contributed content to the book, but who are not credited as one of the primary authors or editors.
## Journalists, newspaper writers (e.g. Alan Schwarz), and magazine article writers (e.g. James Surowiecki).
## Authors of scholarly works (e.g. Stephen Jay Gould).
Things that are NOT authors:
## Scriptwriters for television and film (e.g. Akiva Goldsman). Use the types mso:tv.writer and mso:film.writer for these.
## Illustrators that created the interior illustrations of the book (e.g. Mary GrandPr??). Use the mso:book.illustrator type for these.
## Readers of audio books (e.g. Jonathan Davis). Use mso:book.audio_book_reader for these.
## Cover artists that created the cover art for the book (e.g. Glen Orbik). Use mso:book.illustrator for these.
## Translators of written works (e.g. Jerome). Use mso:book.translator for these.
## Visual artists such as painters (e.g. Thomas Kinkade) Use mso:visual_art.visual_artist for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: the date on which the author ceased his writing activity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active as Author (end)

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: the date on which the author began his writing activity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active as Author (start)

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Specific book editions edited by the given author. This property should NOT include editions of books for which this person is already the editor. Rather, this property should be used for editions of books that have had additional editing done that is not in other editions of this book, such as an annotated or critical edition. If there are multiple versions (such as hardcover and paperback) of such an edition, all should be entered separately.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book editions edited

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a person to editions of books which he or she authored.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book editions published

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: People who have collaborated with the given author in creating a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Coauthors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Books that the given author has contributed to, but for which they are not considered the primary author or editor. Examples include roles as a subeditor, as well as contributions to an anthology or articles in a reference book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contributing author to

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The broad subject matter of the given author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Domain

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An institution associated with the given author, e.g. a college or university.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author Institution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Keywords associated with the given author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Keywords

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The Open Library identifier for the given author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Open Library ID

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an author to the keywords representing the author's name.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author Keywords

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an author to the scholarly works where the author contributed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author Works

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an author to a group of authors that are concerned with a common theme or have a common approach to literature.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: School or Movement

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an author to a literary series where the author contributed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The narrow subject matter of the given author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subdomain

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The subject matter of the given author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Written works that were edited by the given author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Works edited

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an author to works that were written by the author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Works written

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A book of the Christian bible, e.g. Genesis, Job, Matthew, Mark, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Book

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a book of the Bible to one of the chapter of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Chapter

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A first-order division of a book of the Christian bible, e.g. Genesis 3, Mark 4, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Chapter

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The book of the Bible corresponding to the given chapter of the Bible, e.g. the book corresponding to the chapter John 3 would be John.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Book

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a chapter of the Bible with a verse that is part of the chapter.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Verse

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number corresponding to the given chapter of the Bible, e.g. the number corresponding to the chapter John 3 would be 3.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing all of the editions of the Christian Bible, e.g. the King James version, the New International Version, the New Revised Standard Version, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that is used to collect information that is relative to both a section and an edition of the Bible.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Edition Section

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The given edition of the Bible.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the given section of the Bible.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Section

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The actual text corresponding to the given section and edition of the Bible.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that is used for any self-standing part of the Christian Bible, viz. a book, a chapter or a verse.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Section

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a section of the bible, e.g. chapter 2 of the Book of John, to information about the section in a particular edition of the Bible, e.g. the King James Bible.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Edition Section

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A second-order division of a book of the Christian bible, e.g. Genesis 3:2, Mark 4:1, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Verse

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The chapter of the Bible corresponding to the given verse of the Bible, e.g. the chapter corresponding to John 3:4 would be John 3.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bible Chapter

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number corresponding to the given verse of the Bible, e.g. the number corresponding to the verse John 3:4 would be 4.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A written work that is primarily concerned with listing bibliographic information about written works related to a particular author, subject, period, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bibliography

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a bibliography to one of the written works that it cites.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Written Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The format of the book, e.g. leather, paperback, portable document format, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book Binding

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An article that is published as an entry on a blog.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Blog Post

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Written works that are bound and self-contained. The book type represents the most abstract level of thinking about the work. The properties of Book represent those which are always true -- author, date of first publication, series membership, etc. The book edition type, on the other hand, has properties that will vary from publication to publication, so the title of the Book in one edition may be different from the title of the book in another edition (e.g. U.S. editions of "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone" have all been titled "Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone").
Things That Are Books:
## Written works that have been published as stand-alone books.
## Novels (e.g. Eclipse).
## Dissertations (e.g. The Structure of Evolutionary Theory).
## Unpublished novels (e.g. Prince Jellyfish).
Things That Are NOT Books:
## Editions of any existing written work whether in print, audio or digital versions (e.g. The Da Vinci Code). Use mso:book.edition for these.
## comic books (e.g. Tintin in the Congo). Use mso:comic_books.issue for these.
## comic book series (e.g. Sin City). Use mso:comic_books.series for these.
## Book series (e.g. The Dark Tower). Use mso:book.literary_series for these.
## Written works that are published as part of another book (e.g. You Know They Got a Hell of a Band).
## Periodicals (newspapers, magazines, journals).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The names of the characters in a book-length work of fiction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Characters

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Author of Book Edition entities propagated to books for conflation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author of Book Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contributing Authors of Book's Editions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Author of Written Work Edition of Books propagated back for Conflation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a book to the various editions of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book Editions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The first edition of the book, in any state. While there is usually only one first edition, it is possible for books to have multiple first editions. Examples are simultaneous release in two or more countries (such as the later \"Harry Potter\" books), simultaneous paperback and hardcover editions, or simultaneous limited and trade editions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a book to one of the literary genres describing the book, i.e. the mode of writing or the type of content at a high level of generality. Note that this property is multi-valued, because books can have multiple genres.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a book to the person who created the illustrations inside the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interior Illustrator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a book to an action of listening to a sound recording of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Listen Book

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a book directly to its number of ratings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Ratings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a book directly to one of its ratings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking a book directly to one of the rating scales used in its ratings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating Scale

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a book to an action of reading a book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Read Book

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking a book directly to one of the sources of its ratings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Source

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Businesses that specialize in selling books and other media.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bookstore

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Characters in book-length works of fiction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a character to a book in which the character appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book Characters

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The short stories in which the given character appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Short Stories

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A written work that mentions another written work, usually in a bibliography, endnotes or footnotes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cited work
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This notion should not be reified as a primary entity, since it is inherently relational. Use mso:book.work_reference_relationship instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:book.work_reference_relationship]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A written work where the given cited work was mentioned. Only titles of works should be entered as values of this property. Authors, publishers, journal volumea, etc. should not be entered here.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cited in
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use the properties on mso:book.work_reference_relationship instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:book.work_reference_relationship]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A volume that consists of articles, short stories or other self-standing written works that may be authored by the same person or different people.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compilation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An original paper presented at a formal gathering of experts in the given field.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conference Paper

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The conference at which the paper is presented.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conference

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that is used to store the author, title, and page numbers of a written work that appears within another written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The name of the author of the written work that appears in the publication. This is a way to record the name that a given work was published under (which may be different from the author's canonical name).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Credited to

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The page number(s) of the publication that the written work appears on, e.g. 23-28 or 17.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Page Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The title of the publication that the given written work appears in. If the publication is a periodical issue, use a form of the periodical's title and date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The title of the written work that appears in the publication.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The broad subject matter of a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book Domain

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The narrow subject matter of a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subdomain Of a Domain

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A publication of a version of a book.written_work. Note that book.edition is not a subtype of book.written_work, because book.written_work is an abstraction of textual content above the level of the differences that one sees between various editions of a work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The Library of Congress Control Number is a unique identifier assigned by the United States Library of Congress.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: LCCN

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The OCLC number is a unique identifier assigned by the Online Computer Library Center.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: OCLC number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an edition to a person who wrote an afterword or postface to the edition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Afterword Author

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Edition Authors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The format of the book, e.g. leather, paperback, portable document format, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Binding

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The written work corresponding to the given edition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Edition Of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an edition of a book to an edition of a book series, of which the book is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Edition Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A web address that provides a preview of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book Preview URL

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an edition of a book to the authors who contributed to the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contributing Authors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an edition of a book to a person who illustrated the cover of the edition.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The price of the book edition printed on the cover. If the book has prices in multiple currencies, all can be entered here.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cover Price

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The name of the author as printed on the publication. This is a way to record the name that a given work was published under when it is different from the author's canonical name: book.written_work.author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Credited Author

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of the Dewey Decimal classification system that is assigned to the given edition of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dewey Decimal Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an edition of a book to a person who was reponsible for editing the edition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Edition Editors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A web address that provides the full contents of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Full Book URL

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The height of the spine of the book, in centimeters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Height

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an edition of a book to a person who created the interior illustrations of the edition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interior Illustrator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an edition to a person who wrote an introduction, foreword or preface to the edition.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The pub_id of this edition at the Internet Speculative Fiction Database (www.isfdb.org)
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISFDB ID

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:book.edition to the list.list_item relationship of which the edition is a part.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.edition to keywords in the book's text.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Keyword

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The language or languages of the edition of the written work. These languages may or may not include the original language of the work.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The Library of Congress Classification is a subject classification maintained by the U.S. Library of Congress.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: LCC

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The length of the book, viz. the length from the spine to the vertical edge of the book, in centimeters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The pagination of the given book edition, with one number indicating the front matter (a small roman numeral) and one number indicating the body matter (a decimal number)
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of pages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The location where the given edition of the book was published. This will usually be a city, listed on the title page.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place of publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property that relates an edition of a book to a public library that has the edition in its collection.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property that relates an edition of a book to a public library system that has the edition in its common collection.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The company or imprint that published the given edition.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an audio edition of a book to the person who read the book for the audio edition.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The price of the book edition printed on the cover. If the book has prices in multiple currencies, all can be entered here.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.edition to the weight of the individual editions.

Note that book.literary_series is used for the book series itself, rather than the editions of it.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking the editorial title, e.g. Editor-in-chief, science editor, editor for reviews, etc., to information about the editors that held the title.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type to store information about the tenure of an editor of a periodical, e.g. when the job began, when it ended, title held, etc.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the editor of the periodical.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date that the person became editor of the periodical.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking the editors of a periodical to the periodical itself.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The title of the editor, e.g. editor-in-chief, science editor, editor for reviews, etc. If a person has worked for the same periodical in multiple editorial roles, then each role should correspond to a unique instance of this relationship type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Title

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date that the person ceased being editor of the periodical.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A message that is sent and received using standard Internet protocols.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Email

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the body or main part of the message.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Body

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the complete set of automatically generated metadata attached to the message by clients and servers as the message is routed to its destination.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Header

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the date/time that the message was received.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Timestamp Received

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the email address(es) that are the intended,primary recipients of the message. This property should not be used to related an email message to cc: and bcc: recipients, for which there are separate properties.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recipient

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the email address(es) that are the blind carbon copy recipients of the message.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Blind Carbon Copy Recipient

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the email address(es) that are the carbon copy recipients of the message.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Carbon Copy Recipient

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the email address from which the message was sent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sender

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the date/time that the message was sent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Timestamp Sent

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an email message to the subject line of the message.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A brief extract from a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Excerpt

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an excerpt of a written work to an action of reading the excerpt.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Read Excerpt

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an excerpt of a written work to the work from which it was excerpted.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Work Excerpted

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A written work from which an excerpt is made.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Excerpted Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a written work to an excerpt of that work that was published separately.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Excerpts

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A written work consisting of a narrative of imaginary events and characters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Written Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A written work that is primarily concerned with listing the films related to a particular director, actor, period, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Filmography

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a filmography to one of the films cited in the work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person or organization that provides funding to develop or publish a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Financial support provider

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An answer that is offered to a forum question on an online discussion site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Forum Answer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates that a moderator of the given forum has recommended the given answer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Approved Answer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of users of the given forum that indicated that they found the given answer helpful.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Helpful Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A message, whether a question, an answer to a question or a comment, in an online discussion site or board.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Forum Posting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.forum_posting to its number of dislikes, or down votes, which indicate the number of users that did not like the post, found it irrelevant, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: DisLiked Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of users of the forum who indicated that they "liked" the forum posting.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Posting Liked Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.forum_posting to its parent mso:book.forum_posting.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Parent Posting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of users of the forum who indicated that they would recommend the forum posting to other users.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Forum Recommended Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A question that is posted on an online discussion site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Forum Question

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a forum question to one of the answers offered to the question in the forum.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Forum Answer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of answers that have been offered to the given forum question.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Forum Answer Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of users in the forum who indicated that they had the same question as the given question.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Same Question Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who creates illustrations for a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Illustrator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an illustrator to books that were illustrated by him or her.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Books illustrated

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an illustrator to book covers that were illustrated by him or her.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book edition covers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an illustrator to book editions whose interior illustrations were created by him or her.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Book editions illustrated

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an illustrator to magazine covers that were illustrated by him or her.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Magazine covers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an illustrator to magazine issues (some of) whose interior artwork was created by the illustrator.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Magazine Issues Illustrated

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Published accounts of formal conversations between people.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interview

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date on which the interview was conducted. This property should not be used to record the date of publication of the interview.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date of interview

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an interview to a or the person interviewed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interviewee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an interview to a or the person who conducted the interview.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interviewer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who was interviewed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interviewee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a person to an interview which he or she has given.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interviews Given

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who interviewed someone else.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interviewer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a person to an interview which he or she has conducted.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interviews Conducted

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A periodical that publishes scholarly articles in an academic field of study.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Journal

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an academic journal to articles that have appeared in the journal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Articles

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of academic works citied in the given journal to date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Citation Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an academic journal to the discipline, e.g. biology, history, computer science, etc., that is covered by the journal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Discipline

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an academic journal to the subscription price for an individual subscriber.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Individual price

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an academic journal to the subscription price for an institutional subscriber, e.g. a university or a company.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Institutional price

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an academic journal to a relationship type expressing the time when and the place where the journal was published.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place of publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of articles published in the given journal to date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Publication Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Articles that are published in academic journals.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Journal Article

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an academic journal article to information about the journal where the article appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Journal Publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that stores information about when and where an article appeared in an academic journal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Journal publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking bibliographic information about an article in an academic journal to the journal article itself.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Journal Article

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The first page number of the journal where the article appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First Page

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date of an issue of an academic journal. Note that the value of this property must be a datetime. Information about the issue date that does not conform to this restriction should be entered as a value of book.journal_publication.issue_date_extra.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Issue Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that is used to store issue date information for a journal publication that does not have a datetime format, such as \"Summer\" or \"January 1-8\". See book.journal_publication.issue_date for information that does have a datetime format.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Issue date extra

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The issue number of the journal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Issue Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking bibliographic information about an article in an academic journal to the academic journal itself.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Academic Journal

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The last page number of the journal where the article appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Last Page

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The page(s) of the journal issue that the article appeared on, e.g. 23-28 or 17.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The volume of the journal issue that the article appeared in.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Volume

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A keyword for a title, author, subject or other element of bibliographic data.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Keyword

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A stemming variation for a keyword of a title, author, subject or other element of bibliographic data.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Keyword Stemming Variation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A collection of books that are published in a sequence and are intended to form a unit. A literary series can be a variety of things: a series of novels or other works of fiction that tell a continuing story such as Frank Herbert's "Dune" series, Lawrence Durrell's "Alexandria Quartet," or Aeschylus' "Oresteia". Note that book.edition_series should be used for editions of book series, and book.serialized_work is used for works that are serialized, published in installments rather than in a single volume.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Literary Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a literary series to the author(s) of the series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a literary series to the fictional universe where the series is set, e.g. the series Lord of the Rings would be related to Middle Earth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a literary series to a number indicating how many volumes make up the series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Series Volumes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a literary series to another series of which it is a part. In other words, it relates a subseries to a superseries of written works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Part of Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a literary series to another series, when the second is a part of the first. In other words, it relates a superseries to a subseries of written works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Literary Subseries

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a literary series to the works that are a part of the series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Series Works

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A periodical that is published on a weekly or monthly basis, typically on glossy paper with photographs and other graphics.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Magazine

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a magazine to a genre of the magazine, e.g. News, Fashion, Cooking, Science Fiction, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The place the magazine is published, and the years it was published there.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place of publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a genre to the magazines that are part of the genre.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Magazines in the Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A particular edition of a magazine, e.g. Vanity Fair, December 2011.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Magazine Issue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an issue of a magazine to a person who created illustrations for the cover of the issue.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cover Artist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The cover price (as displayed on the issue); multiple prices can be listed if they are given.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cover Price

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking an issue of a magazine to a person who created illustrations for the interior of the issue.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interior Illustrator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Stores that specialize in selling printed news media, e.g. magazines, journals, and newspapers. See comic_books.store for shops that specialize in graphic media.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Magazine Store

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary Entity representing news topics. This collection includes entities like "Sports", "Weather", and "Lifestyle". These are the broad categories a newspaper or news website might use to organize articles.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: News Topic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A periodical that is published on a daily or weekly basis and is printed on large sheets of newsprint paper.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspaper

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of subscribers to a particular edition of the newspaper.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Circulation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The primary location(s) where the newspaper is circulated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Circulation Areas

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The address of the newspaper's headquarters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspaper Headquarters

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The person, organization, or company that owns the newspaper.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Owner

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The price to subscribe to a particular edition of the newspaper.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Price

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that relates circulation information to a date and an edition for which the information is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspaper circulation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The average number of copies sold of this edition of the newspaper.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Circulation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date for which the circulation number is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The edition of the newspaper, such as daily, Sunday or weekly, for which the circulation number is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The kind of newspaper edition, such as daily, Sunday or weekly.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspaper edition type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A particular edition of a newspaper, e.g. Washington Post, April 14, 2011.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspaper Issue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The person, organization, or company that owns the newspaper.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspaper Owner

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a person to the newspapers owned by the person.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspapers Owned

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that connects an edition of a newspaper to its price and currency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Newspaper price

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The price of the given edition of the newspaper.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Amount

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The currency for which the price of the given edition of the newspaper is to be understood.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Currency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The edition of the newspaper (such as daily, Sunday, morning, evening, etc.) for which the price is provided.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The collection of online editions of a written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Online Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A link to an online edition of the book in ePUB format.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Online ePUB Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an online edition of a book to a file format in which the edition is available.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: File Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A link to an online edition of the book in html format.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: HTML Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A link to an online edition of the book in kindle format.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Online Kindle Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A link to an online edition of the book in PDF format.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Online PDF Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A link to an online edition of the book in text format.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Online Text Edition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type to store information about the number of pages, both in the front matter and in the body of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pagination

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of pages in the front matter (typically indicated with Roman numerals). Do not use this property if the front matter is not paginated separately from the rest of the book.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Front matter

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of pages in the body of the book. Some books (such as omnibuses or Bibles) may have multiple, individually-numbered sections, which should be entered with two separate values.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Numbered pages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A publication that is issued at regular intervals, usually daily, weekly, monthly or bimonthly, and is made up of articles by different authors.
Things that are periodicals:
## Magazines (e.g. Der Spiegel).
## Newspapers (e.g. Asahi Shimbun).
## Journals (e.g. Numen).
## Alt-Weeklies (e.g. The SF Bay Guardian).
## Periodic Zines (e.g. Sniffin' Glue).
## Student Newspapers (e.g. Heraldo Filipino).
## Ezines (e.g. Spectrofon).
## Lift-outs and supplements (e.g.: Good Weekend, which is distributed with The Age and The Sydney Morning Herald).
Things that are NOT periodicals:
## Individual issues of any of the above. These should be typed as mso:book.periodical_issue or one of its subtypes.
## Comic books. Individual comic book issues should be typed as mso:comic_books.issue, while comic book series should be typed as mso:comic_books.series.
## The companies that publish any of the above (e.g. The New York Times Company is typed as mso:book.periodical_publisher).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The average number of issues of the periodical sold.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Circulation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: People who are responsible for selecting and finalizing the content published in the given periodical. This type covers all levels of editorial staff, including editorial boards, from editor-in-chief to assistant editor, and even former editors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Editorial Staff

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a periodical to information about its final issue, if it has ceased publication.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Final issue date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a periodical to information about its first issue.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First issue date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a periodical to information about the format that it had and when it had it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a periodical to information about the number of times that the periodical appeared per year and the time frame when the periodical had the given frequency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Frequency or Issues per Year

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The genre of the periodical, e.g. News, Fashion, Cooking, Science Fiction, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The language or languages in which the periodical is published.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The place the periodical is published, and the years in which it was published there.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place of publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a periodical to information about who published the periodical during which periods.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical Publisher

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Enter subjects only for periodicals that deal primarily with one or more specific subjects.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subjects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: People who are responsible for selecting and finalizing the content for newspapers, magazines or journals.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical editor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a person to information about the editorial positions held by the person.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical Editors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The size of the paper on which the periodical is printed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a periodical format to information about which periodicals had this format and when.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Format of Periodicals

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that is used to specify the period of time when a given periodical had a certain format.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical Format Period

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the size of the paper on which the periodical is printed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date that this format was first used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Begin Period

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking information about periodical format to the periodical itself.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date that this format was last used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: End Period

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that is used to store information about how often a periodical is published.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical Frequency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: If the periodical is published on a regular (i.e. periodic) schedule, specify the frequency. Otherwise, use the \"issues per year\" property.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Frequency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The beginning date when the periodical had the specified frequency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Beginning Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: If the periodical is not published on a regular (i.e. periodic) schedule, enter the number of issues per year. Otherwise, the property mso:book.periodical_frequency.frequency should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Issues Per Year

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The ending date when the periodical had the specified frequency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ending Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A particular number of a periodical, e.g. Vanity Fair, December 2011.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Periodical Issue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a periodical issue to an editor of the issue.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Editor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a periodical issue to the number corresponding to the issue.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Issue Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The beginning of the period of time when the publisher was at the given location.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The location of the publisher during the given period of time. Enter the city if known, otherwise the state/province or country.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The ending of the period of time when the publisher was at the given location.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Characters who appear in a poem. Note that characters generally appear only in narrative forms of poetry, e.g. epics.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A type that is used for self-contained textual content, whether an article, a report, a book, a poem, etc. It is a fairly generic type that contains information common to all or most types of written works, including (but not limited to) books, plays, poems, stories, scholarly articles, book reviews, and essays
Things that are written works:
## Literary works such as fiction, short stories, poems, drama, etc. (e.g. Ficciones, The Catcher in the Rye, Twilight).
## Non-fiction works such as essays, reviews, articles, biographies, etc. A non-fiction work can either be part of larger publications such as books or journals (e.g. Evolution by Jerks, The Piracy Paradox) or a book by itself (e.g. Between Silk and Cyanide, Rich Dad, Poor Dad). ## Research works such as thesis and dissertations (e.g. Applied Stochastic Eigen-Analysis, The Concept of Potentiality).
## Scholarly works such as articles published in journals, conference proceedings and other scholarly publications (e.g. Size and Scaling in Human Evolution, The Paradox of Genius).
## Works that are published in eBook form and other electronic or digital formats (e.g. Leadership IQ, Optical Networking eBook).
## Works using ancient writings and inscriptions (e.g. Berlin Papyrus, Book of the Dead).
Things that are NOT written works:
## Editions of any existing written work whether in print, audio or digital versions (e.g. Ender's Game, The Ruby Way eBook edition, Pride and Prejudice). The type mso:book.edition should be used for these. This type is not a subtype of book.written_work, because book.written_work is an abstraction of textual content above the level of the differences that one sees between various editions of a work.
## Newspapers, magazines, journals and other serial publications. Use mso:book.periodical and its subtypes for newspapers (e.g. New York Times, San Francisco Chronicles, magazines (e.g. Fortune, PC World), and journals (e.g. American Journal of Education, American Quarterly).
## Periodical issues. Use mso:book.periodical_issue for these.
## Comic books and comic strips (e.g. The Little King, Hagar the Horrible, Peanuts). Use mso:comic_books.issue and mso:comic_strips.comic_strip for these.
## Adaptations of written works. Use mso:media_common.adaptation for these.
## Printed musical works such as sheet music, musical scores and song lyrics. Use mso:music.composition for these.
## Legal documents (e.g. recording contracts, United States Constitution, Legislative Reorganization Act).
## Miscellaneous printed materials such as calendars, posters, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Written Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A score that is intended to measure the reading difficulty of a written work and is assigned on the basis of the following formula: (10 + reading level) x (words in book ?? 100,000).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Accelerated Reading Points

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A numeric assessment of reading difficulty generated by software developed by Advantage Learning Systems and Touchstone Applied Science Associates.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ATOS Level

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a written work to its author.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Author

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a written work to information about creative works cited in the written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Citation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a written work to another written work in which it appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date or dates that the given written work was copyrighted.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Copyright Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date that the written work was first published, in any form.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date of First Publication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The time interval when the written work was completed. If the exact date is known, the property book.written_work.date_written should be used instead.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Range Written

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date that the written work was completed. If the exact date is not known, the property book.written_work.date_range_written can be used instead.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Written

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a written work to its editor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Editor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.written_work to its Lexile test measure. It is based on individual words and sentence lengths in a work, rather than qualitative analysis of content to produce scores.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lexile Text Measure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a written work to an action of listening to a sound recording of the work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Listen Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a written work to the literary series, if there is one, of which the written work is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Part of Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.written_work to the mso.location.location where the work was written.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: If the given work is part of a series, the value for this property is the work that occurs next in the series. For works of fiction, the sequence should usually follow the chronology of the story.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Next in Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.written_work to the number of pages in this work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Page Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Enter links to online versions of this work here.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Online versions
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use book.edition.full_book_URL, because an online version is an edition of the written work. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:book.edition.full_book_URL]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The language(s) in which the work was first written.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Original Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links two written works when the second is a part of the first, e.g. a poem that is part of a collection, an article that is part of an anthology or a chapter of a novel.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Part

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a written work to the previous work in the series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Previous in Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a written work to an action of reading the work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Read Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of references in the written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Reference Count

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a written work to the relevant literary school or movement, i.e. a group of authors that are concerned with a common theme or have a common approach to literature.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: School or Movement

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a written work to a section of the written work. Note that, since mso:book.section inherits from mso:book.written_work, this property can be used to chain together sections, subsections, subsubsections, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Section

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:book.written_work to another mso:book.written_work that is similar.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Similar Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The topics of the given written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subjects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a written work to a summary or abstract of the written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Synopsis

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a written work to its table of contents. Note that this property has a different meaning from book.written_work.contents, which is used to link two written_works when one is part of the other.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Table of Contents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a written work to a URL providing its table of contents. Note that this property has a different meaning from book.written_work.contents, which is used to link two written_works when one is part of the other.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Table of Contents URL

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Translations of the given work. The translation's title should be entered as it is expressed in the target language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Translations

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a written work to one of its versions. This property can be used to relate books to their published editions, but it can also be used to relate poems, essays, short stories, etc. to their various forms.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Written Work Versions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of words making up the written work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Word Count
